title: incremental comp ICE from string escape sequences (maybe)

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

body:
Hi, 
I work on a learning project, and I've got this error when I try to compile tests:

```
$ 😔 cargo test -- --nocapture                                                                                                                                                                         [22:46:12] 
   Compiling notes v0.1.3 (/home/user/linux-utils/notes)
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'index out of bounds: the len is 168 but the index is 171', /rustc/412f43ac5b4ae8c3599e71c6972112e9be4758fa/src/libcore/slice/mod.rs:2797:10
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace.

error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

note: rustc 1.41.0-nightly (412f43ac5 2019-11-24) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu

note: compiler flags: -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental

note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden

error: could not compile `notes`.

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
```

**I tried this code:**

```
    pub fn search_should_skip_title() -> () {
        let note = Note::from(
            0,
            PathBuf::from("/tmp/note-1.txt"),
            SAMPLE_NOTE_CONTENT.to_string())
            .ok()
            .unwrap();
        assert_eq!(note.format_for_search(&"ssh".to_string(), 10), "\n\u{1b}[32m@0\u{1b}[0m \u{1b}[36m# SSH\u{1b}[0m \u{1b}[2m(Score: 10)\u{1b}[0m \n\n\u{1b}[2m3. \u{1b}[0m A note about \u{1b}[33mSSH\u{1b}[0m");
    }
```

**An example (MCVE) is available here**: https://github.com/remipassmoilesel/notes/tree/issue/compiler-2019-12-08-22-44


**I expected to see this happen:** Green tests :)


## Meta

`rustc --version --verbose`:

```
$ 😔 rustc --version --verbose                                                                                                                                                                         [22:46:14] 
rustc 1.41.0-nightly (412f43ac5 2019-11-24)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 412f43ac5b4ae8c3599e71c6972112e9be4758fa
commit-date: 2019-11-24
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.41.0-nightly
LLVM version: 9.0

```
